alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 3:23AM MDT until June 15 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River near Crowheart affecting Fremont County. .Unseasonably warm temperatures has resulted in rapid snowmelt. As a result water levels in the Wind River have risen to near or above flood stage. For the Wind River Basin...including Dubois, Crowheart, Kinnear, Riverton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and will continue to occur today. * WHERE...Wind River near Crowheart. * WHEN...Until Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Bankfull stage. At 9.5 feet, Very minor low land flooding begins. At 10.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor low land flooding becomes more widespread. Access road to gage begins to be covered with water. At 10.5 feet, Moderate low land flooding upstream and downstream of gage. Access to gage is becomes limited. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage since Saturday evening was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 10.3 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
